page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY Page 1 _ BORTH
page.content: {Submerged forest }Remains of pine and birch trees can be seen at low tides. {Aurochs} Footprints thought to belong to the Aurochs, a bison_like animal have been found at Borth, and a skeleton discovered some fifteen years ago. {Caer Allt Goch}(SN64118837) A small hill fort/settlement of 0.8 hectares with only one entrance to the east. It is thought to be part of a system of forts or settlements. {Pantyfedwen} A beautiful building built in 1870 as the Borth Hydropathic Establishment by Thomas Savin when he brought the railway to Borth. It became the Grand Hotel but was bought and presented to the Urdd by D.J.James in 1947 and calledd Pantyfedwen. Tragically, its upkeep was too much, it was sold and, owing to its state of disrepair was demolished in 1979.
